p: Coronavirus is the longest known RNA virus, with a length of 27–32 kb [ 14]. In 2014, the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses (ICTV) divided coronaviruses into four genera, α, β, γ, δ. Of the four coronavirus genera, seven have been found to be pathogenic to humans, α: HCoV-229E, HCoV-NL63; β: HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV. The newly discovered SARS-CoV-2 also belongs to the β genus [ 9, 15].
